alert.note: Alert for Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 08 at 6:54AM CDT until August 10 at 3:19AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Pecatonica River at Freeport affecting Stephenson County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pecatonica River at Freeport. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Minor street flooding begins in Freeport and water affects a few back yards east of the Pecatonica River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 13.6 feet. The river continues to rise rapidly but the rate of increase is starting to slow. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. There is a possibility that the river may rise above 14 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
